description: Borrowed from French liqueur. Doublet of liquor.

entries.meaning: A flavoured alcoholic beverage that is usually very sweet and contains a high percentage of alcohol.

verbs.description: liqueur (third-person singular simple present liqueurs, present participle liqueuring, simple past and past participle liqueured)

entries.meaning: to flavor or treat (wine) with a liqueur
to top up bottles of sparkling wine with a sugar solution
examples: Every champagne has to be liqueured after its disgorgement, to replace the inevitable loss.
